column1: #Text=# ABIDES: Agent-Based Interactive Discrete Event Simulation environment
#Text=ABIDES (Agent Based Interactive Discrete Event Simulator) is a general purpose multi-agent discrete event simulator.
#Text=Agents exclusively communicate through an advanced messaging system that supports latency models.
#Text=The project is currently broken down into 3 parts: ABIDES-Core, ABIDES-Markets and ABIDES-Gym
#Text=* ABIDES-Core: Core general purpose simulator that be used as a base to build simulations of various systems.
#Text=* ABIDES-Markets: Extension of ABIDES-Core to financial markets.
#Text=Contains implementation of an exchange mimicking NASDAQ, stylised trading agents and configurations.
#Text=* ABIDES-Gym: Extra layer to wrap the simulator into an OpenAI Gym environment for reinforcement learning use. 2 ready to use trading environments available.
#Text=Possibility to build other financial markets environments easily.
#Text=[ABIDES-Gym: Gym Environments for Multi-Agent Discrete Event Simulation and Application to Financial Markets](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2110.14771.pdf) or use
#Text=      title={ABIDES-Gym: Gym Environments for Multi-Agent Discrete Event Simulation and Application to Financial Markets},
#Text=      author={Selim Amrouni and Aymeric Moulin and Jared Vann and Svitlana Vyetrenko and Tucker Balch and Manuela Veloso},
#Text=[ABIDES: Towards High-Fidelity Market Simulation for AI Research](https://arxiv.org/abs/1904.12066)
#Text=      title={ABIDES: Towards High-Fidelity Market Simulation for AI Research},
#Text=      author={David Byrd and Maria Hybinette and Tucker Hybinette Balch},
#Text=Download the ABIDES source code, either directly from GitHub or with git:
#Text=    **Note:** The latest stable version is contained within the `main` branch.
#Text=Run the install script to install the ABIDES packages and their dependencies:
#Text=Regular ABIDES simulations can be run either directly in python or through the command line
#Text=_For more examples, please refer to the [Documentation](https://example.com)_
#Text=The config can be loaded and the simulation run using the `abides`
#Text=The first argument is a path to a valid ABIDES configuration file.
#Text=Any further arguments are optional and can be used to overwrite any parameters
#Text=ABIDES can also be run through a Gym interface using ABIDES-Gym environments.
#Text=ABIDES currently has the following available background Market Simulation Configuration:
#Text=* RMSC03: 1 Exchange Agent, 1 POV Market Maker Agent, 100 Value Agents, 25 Momentum Agents, 5000 Noise Agents
#Text=* RMSC04: 1 Exchange Agent, 2 Market Maker Agents, 102 Value Agents, 12 Momentum Agents, 1000  Noise Agents
#Text=Contributions are what make the open source community such an amazing place to learn, inspire, and create.
#Text=If you have a suggestion that would make this better, please fork the repo and create a pull request.
#Text=You can also simply open an issue with the tag "enhancement".
#Text=Don't forget to give the project a star!
#Text=TODO: add information about JPMC contribution agreement
#Text=Push to the Branch (`git push origin feature/AmazingFeature`)
#Text=ABIDES was originally developed by David Byrd and Tucker Balch: https://github.com/abides-sim/abides

#Text=ABIDES is currently developed and maintained by [Jared Vann](https://github.com/jaredvann) (aka @jaredvann), [Selim Amrouni](https://github.com/selimamrouni) (aka @selimamrouni), and [Aymeric Moulin](https://github.com/AymericCAMoulin) (@AymericCAMoulin).
#Text=**Important Note: We do not do technical support, nor consulting** and don't answer personal questions per email.
